title: San Francisco/Western Addition
name: Alamo Square Park
address: between Steiner, Scott, Fulton and Hayes Streets
image: https://en.wikivoyage.org/wiki/File:View from Alamo Square, San Francisco-2.jpg
content: This park is best known for the famous '''Painted Ladies''' row of Victorian houses on its east side along Steiner Street, which is often the subject of many a San Francisco postcard. There are also many other pretty Victorians encircling the lovely park. The 21-Hayes bus route goes along its south side, the 5-Fulton bus passes by a block north of the park, or if you enjoy walking and don't mind modest grades you can get there by walking west from Hayes Valley or north from the [[San Francisco/Haight|Haight]].
